intro: Athamanta denudata, commonly known as the naked athamantia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in summer and attract various pollinators. Athamanta denudata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
